actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to make the provisions of the Public Safety Officers Benefits Act retroactive to January 1, 1972, and to include volunteer ambulance, first-aid and rescue squad members as Public Safety Officers eligible to receive benefits thereunder.
short_title: Volunteer Ambulance, First Aid, and Rescue Squad Personnel Benefits Act

summary.text: Volunteer Ambulance, First Aid, and Rescue Squad Personnel Benefits Act - Amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to extend public safety officer death benefits to members of volunteer ambulance, first aid, or rescue squads. Makes coverage under the Public Safety Officers Benefits Act retroactive so as to apply to death occurring after 1971.

titles.title: Volunteer Ambulance, First Aid, and Rescue Squad Personnel Benefits Act

A bill to make the provisions of the Public Safety Officers Benefits Act retroactive to January 1, 1972, and to include volunteer ambulance, first-aid and rescue squad members as Public Safety Officers eligible to receive benefits thereunder.
